# Team Structure & Departments {#sec-team}

## Overview

The Namma Cloud Admin Team is organized into clear functional areas, each with defined responsibilities and growth paths. As the team matures, members will expand across multiple areas.

## Roles & Responsibilities

### Project Lead

| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| **Focus** | Strategic direction, vendor management, cross-team coordination |
| **Decisions** | Hardware procurement, data center design, team composition |
| **Reviews** | Weekly progress, incident reports, learning outcomes |

### Team Lead — Admin Operations

| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| **Focus** | Day-to-day operations, team coordination, quality assurance |
| **Skills Required** | Technical knowledge of server hardware, networking basics, leadership |
| **Key Tasks** | Assign work, review Maker-Checker outputs, conduct RCAs, run daily standups |
| **Language** | Bridges communication between project lead and team members |

### Physical Infrastructure Team Members

| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| **Focus** | Hands-on server transportation, installation, cabling |
| **Skills Being Built** | Hardware handling, basic networking, documentation, AI tool usage |
| **Key Tasks** | Follow SOPs, complete checklists, report issues, participate in learning |
| **Growth Path** | Physical Ops → Network Basics → OS/Linux → Cloud Ops |

## Departments & Functions

### 1. Physical Infrastructure Operations

**Scope:** All physical tasks related to data center hardware.

- Server transportation and receiving
- Server rack installation and fitting
- Power connection and management
- Network cabling and connectivity
- Hardware health verification
- Environmental monitoring (temperature, humidity)

### 2. Quality & Governance

**Scope:** Ensuring every task meets quality standards.

- Maintain and update SOPs
- Run Maker-Checker processes
- Track and manage issues/tickets
- Conduct Root Cause Analysis (RCA)
- Implement Corrective and Preventive Actions (CAPA)
- Audit trail maintenance

### 3. Learning & Development

**Scope:** Continuous upskilling of all team members.

- Daily 5-minute learning moments
- Weekly deep-dive sessions
- AI tool training
- Language skill development
- Namma DSL training
- Progress tracking and certification

### 4. DSL & Automation (Future)

**Scope:** Interfacing with Namma DSL for infrastructure management.

- Updating hardware specs in Namma DSL
- Running validation checks
- Contributing to digital twin accuracy
- Automated reporting
- Integration with monitoring systems

## Communication Channels

| Channel | Purpose | Frequency |
|---------|---------|-----------|
| **Daily Standup** | Status, blockers, learning moment | Daily, 15 min |
| **Issue Ticket** | Report and track issues | As needed |
| **RCA Meeting** | Deep-dive into incidents | Within 72 hours of incident |
| **Weekly Review** | Progress, metrics, planning | Weekly, 30 min |
| **Learning Session** | Deep-dive into a topic | Weekly, 1 hour |
| **DSL Check-in** | Update/review DSL changes | As needed |

## Escalation Path

```{mermaid}
%%| label: fig-escalation
%%| fig-cap: "Issue Escalation Path"
flowchart LR
    A[Team Member identifies issue] --> B[Log ticket immediately]
    B --> C{Severity?}
    C -->|Low| D[Team Lead reviews in daily standup]
    C -->|Medium| E[Team Lead reviews within 4 hours]
    C -->|High| F[Team Lead + Project Lead notified immediately]
    C -->|Critical| G[All hands — stop other work]
    D --> H[Resolution & RCA]
    E --> H
    F --> H
    G --> H
```

### Severity Definitions

| Severity | Definition | Example | Response Time |
|----------|-----------|---------|---------------|
| **Critical** | Infrastructure at risk of damage or safety hazard | Server falling from rack, electrical hazard | Immediate |
| **High** | Significant impact on project timeline or hardware | Server not powering on after install | < 1 hour |
| **Medium** | Issue that needs attention but no immediate risk | Alignment issue during rack fitting | < 4 hours |
| **Low** | Minor issue, cosmetic, or improvement opportunity | Cable labeling inconsistency | Next standup |
